page.title: 06WORK IN BICESTER.
page.content: EMPLOYMENT:The job centre was built in 1984 in Manorsfield Road and last year handled 1,349 vacancies.As one of the government cuts the job centre was planned for closure next year but due to public protest the future of the centre looks certain.9.3% of the 17,500 population are unemployed. ARMY DEPOT:Over 3,000 civilians from the Bicester area are employed at the Central Ordnance Depot as storekeepers and clerks. INDUSTRIAL ESTATE:New industries have developed over the past few years on the industrial estate along the Launton Road.There are several distribution centres and factories.Formula 11 racing cars are also made here.
